title: Fielding Hills 2013 Tribute Estate Riverbend Vineyard Red (Wahluke Slope)
description: Aromas of vanilla, coconut, barrel spice and dark fruit are followed by plentiful black-fruit flavors. It brings a lot of appeal, mixing fruit and barrel.

title: François Lurton 2013 Hacienda Araucano Alka Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Initially, this smells heavy, earthy, nutty and even a bit raisiny. In the mouth, this is chunky and rich, with pounding tannins. The flavor profile is much like a chocolate parfait, with sweet, nutty, spicy notes. On the finish, copious oak is reflected via clove, mint and wood-spice flavors. Drink this lush, sticky Carmenère through 2021.

title: Friedeman 2014 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site farmed by the great Ulises Valdez, this barrel-aged white is remarkably subtle on the oak, allowing bright, rich flavors of lemon, lime and mango to shine through, along with more complex aspects of green apple and anise.

title: Gård 2012 Grand Klasse Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas pop, with notes of jammy dark cherry, dried black currant, black licorice and baking spices. The dried-fruit flavors are full, with a dry squeeze of tannins. It seems a bit evolved for its age.

title: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine comes from vineyards planted in the late 1970s. It shows pleasing aromas of Bosc pear, melon and flowers. The wine tastes a hair off dry, with a full, appealing feel to the apple and passion fruit flavors.

title: Leyda 2015 Single Vineyard Garuma Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: Briny, lightly green citrus aromas are round and pungent. A juicy, crisp mouthfeel is formed by citric acidity, while flavors of stony lime and green apple finish crisp and in fine form.

title: Liquid Farm 2015 Vogelzang Vineyard Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A pretty peachy color, this bottling, which is 100% Mourvèdre, shows an intriguingly salty strawberry hint to the nose, where dried cherries and brisk watermelon aromas also pop. There is zesty acidity to the sip with richness in the midpalate, offering flavors of sea-salted peaches, orange-rind tang and impressive length for a rosé.

title: Millbrook 2014 Cabernet Franc (New York)
description: Pretty violet perfume wafts from this aromatic Cabernet Franc. The palate is lush, with black cherries offset by streaks of cranberry and currant acidity. Expansive on the finish, its silky supple mouthfeel lingers long after the last sip.

title: Kunde 2012 Drummond Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This estate wine comes from vines planted two decades ago and was named for John Drummond, who owned the land in the 1800s. With a touch of Cabernet Franc in the mix, it offers black licorice, buoyant acidity and a back beat of tannin that integrates well. Bark, dark plum and chocolate round out the full-bodied picture.

title: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Pleasing aromas of dark plum, clove, vanilla and spice are followed by a deft, flavorful palate. It hangs on the finish.

title: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Beguiling aromas of honeysuckle, lime, peach and baking spices are followed by palate-coating stone-fruit flavors. It shows an impeccable sense of balance.

title: Quivira 2013 Elusive Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine blends 49% Syrah with 27% Mourvèdre, 18% Grenache and 6% Counoise. Together, they provide a smooth, seductive taste of strawberry pie that invites and delights within a full-bodied package that's enjoyable now.

title: Quinta do Noval 2013 Cedro do Noval Red (Duriense)
description: The blend is concentrated and spicy due to Syrah. It is a rich wine, with Douro minerality and concentration, given freshness by the final acidity. Drink this ripe wine now.

title: Pech Merle 2015 Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)
description: In this well-made white, half of the wine was stainless-steel fermented, the other half barrel-fermented. Honeyed aromas of almond and a viscous, medium-bodied texture build weight toward the finish, while never becoming cloying. Vanilla and apricot round out the profile, buoyed by crisp acidity.

title: Sextant 2014 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This is an excellent wine for the price. Aromas of lightly salted nectarines and pan-seared Asian pear are very inviting and pretty. There's a nice sizzle of acidity on the palate and a nervy tension, with lime juice and sea-salt sharpness leading into rounded almond and apple notes in the midpalate.

title: Sextant 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Popcorn, butter-fried apples, seared mandarins, marzipan and a touch of marshmallow show on the very ripe and oily nose of this bottling. The palate is thick with walnut oil, apricot, condensed jasmine and savory salts, right up the alley of those who love big Chardonnays, but not for people seeking fresher expressions.

title: Voyatzis 2015 Kyklos Moschofilero (Peloponnese)
description: Lemon and pineapple aromas start this full-bodied but friendly pour from the Peloponnese. Citrus, sea salt and a mineral finish give the wine elegance and a versatile food character.

title: Waits-Mast 2013 Wentzel Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is smooth, delicious and almost soft in texture. Mild aromas and flavors like cinnamon, red cherry and peach are very attractive, with just enough light tannins and mild acidity to back them up.

title: Waters Crest 2013 Grand Vin Cabernet Franc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Bold hits of spice, vanilla, toast and smoke envelop this Cabernet Franc, but beneath it all, there's a penetrating core of berry and cherry flavors that resonates. It's a hedonistic, perhaps aspirational style of Long Island red wine, but anchored firmly in its fruit. Full-bodied in style, it's structured tautly by fine penetrating tannins and a burst of sour cherry acidity on the midpalate.

title: SuLei 2015 Roussanne (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas are lightly nuanced notes of spice and stone fruit. The palate brings a compelling sense of texture and richness that keeps the attention high.

title: Syzygy 2010 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from Les Collines, Seven Hills and Morrison Lane vineyards, this wine offers aromas of violets along with generous amounts of herb and blue and purple fruit. The palate retains a light, elegant touch.

title: Santa Helena 2013 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Aromas of cherry, cassis, vanilla and mild spice are fruity, clean and inviting. A concentrated, forward palate holds flavors of black fruits, cassis and chocolate. A ripe, solid finish fades away slowly and smoothly. Drink through 2021.

title: Santo Wines 2015 Nykteri White (Santorini)
description: This wine has a banana and lemon character on the nose, followed by complex layers of vanilla, citrus and pineapple. Good mineral balance gives tis fuller bodied wine balance. A pretty white with gravitas?pair with poultry and cheese.

title: Savage Grace 2015 Underwood Mountain Vineyard Riesling (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: The aromas are exuberant, with notes of apricot, jasmine and honeysuckle. It drinks off dry, with abundant stone-fruit flavors that linger on the finish.

title: ZD 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Perfumed in rose garden and earthy compost, this effusively aromatic wine is tightly wound in oak. Yet it's youthful in characteristics of wild strawberry, tea and cardamom, the flavors still waiting to be fully revealed.

title: Tritón 2014 Old Vines  (Toro)
description: Aromas of oak, asphalt, and ripe black fruits make for a lusty, modern nose. The feel is jammy and thick. Flavors of blackberry, chocolate and mocha give way to a strong oak component. A dense finish runs minty and chocolaty, with an emphasis on syrupy richness. Drink through 2021.

title: Buty 2013 Columbia Rediviva Phinny Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (85%) takes the lead on this blend, with the balance Syrah. It brings aromas of earth, green herbs, citrus and cherry that are followed by ripe cherry flavors and a firm squeeze of slightly dry tannins.

title: Bolney Wine Estate 2013 Cuvée Rosé Pinot Noir (England)
description: A creamy, floral shade of green on the nose turns into a crisp, very balanced freshness on the palate, reminiscent of pink grapefruit. The palate boosts fruity pink-grapefruit notes and adds creamy, well-founded balance. Somehow this is resonant and moreish, drawing you in with its seam of freshness. This may be pale pink but its intent is serious and grown-up. Wonderfully dry finish.

title: Breathless NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This classy, dry wine looks coppery in color, smells like cinnamon and cherries, and tastes crisp and appetizing. It has great balance, good flavors and a lingering finish.

title: Brecon Estate 2014 Petit Verdot (Templeton Gap District)
description: Blackberry and black cassis meet with deep lilacs on the rich but somewhat single-toned nose of this bottling. The palate is bursting with fresh blackberrry juice, leveled by touches of cedar and pipe tobacco.
